channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 33 george street on pavement broken bottle, 27th June
item.description:
Broken alcohol bottle glass need to clear out from pavement outside 33 george street can cause hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, George Street, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wearing of double yellow lines, 27th June
item.description:
Over the last two years or so, the yellow lines at the far end of Iris Avenue, between 1a & 1b, have been gradually fading away. This area is now regularly used by some motorists to park there, either overnight, and during the day. It is usually the same vehicles, and they are local residents. None of these vehicles get parking tickets. Can the lines be repainted and new signs erected??
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Iris Avenue, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree constantly shedding everything into our garden, 27th June
item.description:
This has been happening for years. It ruined the trampoline and is now seriously affecting the decking and table tennis table with constant fruit, leaf and resin droppings. The decking is ruined and it also attracts birds and squirrels . We have a vulnerable child at the property who needs sensory stimulation but we have had to remove both the trampoline and swing due to this problem . We would be very great to have the tree completely cut back - I didnâ€™t realise previously that I could report this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: CCTV has been sprayed, 27th June
item.description:
Reported to me that 2 masked men with a long ladder after 12 last night use the ladder to spay the camera in Ambleside Close. This was reported to CCTV and they confirmed that it has been sprayed and she must report it to the council.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ambleside Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds, soil and rubble debris, 27th June
item.description:
Despite reporting this 3 times this week and being told it was fixed, the corner is still not clear. I use this path daily as I cannot use SANDWAY PATH due to the blocked access restricting bike from entering the path. I need to access the dropped kerb in order to get up and down this area and this corner is obstructing use. I have had 3 punctures in recent weeks due to the rubble, glass, nails etc which are buried in the soil. Please get a shovel and clear it away. I will only take 10 minutes!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17-24, Withens Close, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Alley way considered as fire exit COMPLETED BLOCKED, 27th June
item.description:
A small alley behind the houses can be considered a fire exit if it provides a safe and unobstructed route for evacuation, is clearly marked as a fire exit, and meets relevant safety regulations. The key is whether it facilitates a clear and accessible path to a place of safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Green, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
